item.content:encoded:
Exodus was arguably one of the best entertainment addons available on Kodi. But, it was discontinued in 2018, and the original developers ditched it altogether. In 2020, Exodus Redux, a fork of the original Exodus, was launched. 

Both have the same logo and interface, but they are two different addons. The Exodus Redux addon is faster thanks to the Lampard scrappers and regular software updates. 

This addon has many features and categories, such as movies, TV shows, documentaries, sports channels, kids’ shows, and more. 

Here’s all you need to know about it. 

Installation Prerequisites

Exodus Redux is a third-party addon, meaning you will need to install it from a third-party repository. To do this, you need to allow installation from unknown sources from Kodi settings. 

After that, install the Exodus Redux repository, which is the home of the Exodus Redux addon.

You will also need to integrate the addon with Real-Debrid to access multiple high-quality links within the shortest time possible.  

Here is all the necessary information:

  1. Name of the add on: Exodus Redux
  2. Repository name: IAC 
  3. Category: Media sources
  4. Media source name: Exodus
  5. Latest working URL: https://i-a-c.github.io/

Installation Guide

First Things First – Enable Installation From Unknown Sources

Go to Home Screen, click on the gear icon, click on system, select “add-ons” on the left side menu, allow installation from “Unknown Sources”, click “yes” when the warning popup appears. 

Installing Exodus Redux Repository

  1. Go to Home Screen, click on Gear Icon, click on File Manager;
  2. Click Add Source, Click None, Type in the URL “https://i-a-c.github.io” and click Done;
  3. Pick a name for the repository (i.e. REDUX) and enter it in the bottom box and click OK;
  4. Click back until you are in the Main Menu, select Addons on the left side; 
  5. Click on the Box Symbol (top left corner), Choose Install From ZIP file, click Yes when a warning appears;
  6. Open “REDUX” Source and choose this file: “repository.exodusredux-0.0.6.zip”
  7. A notification saying “Installed Successfully” will appear.

Installing Exodus Redux Kodi Addon

  1. Go to Home Screen, find Add-ons on the left side, select the box symbol (top left corner) to get to the Addon Browser;
  2. Click on Install From Repository, choose Exodus Repo, click on Video Addons in the category section;
  3. Click on Exodus and hit install, select OK to confirm the installation of dependencies (don’t appear in Kodi 19 Matrix);
  4. A notification saying “Installed Successfully” will appear;
  5. You have now downloaded Exodus to Kodi. You can now access the addon from the main menu. 

Outstanding Features 

Here are some of the features of the Exodus Redux addon: 

  • Has Open and Lambda scrappers, which guarantee high-quality links from the internet.
  • Regularly updated, preventing multiple errors. 
  • Supports Track.tv and non-English streams 
  • Scraps over 50 media sources. 

Compatibility

The original Exodus V8 addon was one of the first third-party Kodi addons to be built. Unfortunately, Exodus Redux, a fork of Exodus V8, is still not compatible with the latest Kodi 19 Matrix version. Instead, it can only work on Kodi 18.1, 18.2, and 17.6. 

Exodus Redux Kodi Addon Alternatives

Exodus Redux is arguably one of the best entertainment Kodi addons available, but it is not compatible with the new Kodi 19 update. If you’re looking for a worthy alternative, here are a few options: 

Movie Theater Butter offers free access to lots of movies, documentaries, and TV shows. In addition, it features content in over 30 languages.

Venom offers premium content and comes equipped with advanced features, such as a YouTube section, library integration, Real-Debrid, Trakt TV support, and so on. 

Asgard is a great alternative if you want an all-around entertainment hub; it features movies, TV shows, anime, sports, documentaries, animation, and so on. Besides, it is compatible with the latest Kodi version. 

Exodus Redux Problems and Troubleshooting Tips 

Once in a while, you are bound to encounter various errors with the Exodus Redux addon, as discussed below. 

No Stream Available Error 

This error may appear because of the following issues:

  • Outdated version of Exodus Redux. 
  • Attempting to stream Ultra High Definition (UHD) content with an unstable internet connection. 
  • Unavailable content. 
  • Problems with your internet service provider. 
  • A component in your network connection prevents Exodus from accessing the content you desire. 

Here’s how to fix these issues.

Check Video Availability and Network Connection

You may encounter this error when accessing geo-restricted content on Kodi. 

To fix it:

  1. Conduct a free online speed test (fast.com is a great alternative) to check if your ISP has throttled your connection. 
  2. Compare the internet speed when not connected to a VPN with the speed when connected. 
  3. Reboot your device, relaunch Kodi and then search for the video once again. 

Update Your Exodus Redux Version

Check the Exodus Redux repository to ensure you have the latest version. If your version is outdated, install the latest, and restart Kodi.

Clear Cache and Excess Data

Accumulated cache causes streams to lag, leading to the ‘No Stream Available’ error. You can easily clear cache data by heading over to the Tools section then clicking on Clear Cache or Clear Providers.

Check the Providers’ Timeout Option

Each provider has a timeout option that displays the ‘No Stream Available’ error if the video you are trying to watch does not load within a stipulated time. If your internet is slow and you want to access High Definition content, it would be best to alter the timeout speed to 60 seconds.

Invest In a Great VPN

Attempting to access geo-restricted content could cause the ‘No Streams Available’ error. In such cases, either your ISP or the government has blocked the content you’re trying to access. A VPN helps bypass such restrictions by masking your IP address. 

Video Cannot Play 

This error appears when you attempt to load a video that’s too large or corrupted.

Whenever the Exodus Redux detects that the video you want to play is corrupted, it will automatically stop streaming and display the ‘Video Cannot Play’ error. In this case, all you need to do is choose an alternative link. 

The error might also appear because of playback problems, missing frames, audio-video syncing errors, misplaced subtitles, etc. When that happens, you will need to perform an advanced video repair.

To do this, upload the problematic video on video repairing apps such as Wondershare Repairit video repair.

Change the Video Playback Quality

You will most likely encounter this error if the video you are trying to access is of High Definition, yet your internet speed is slow. To fix this, change the video quality from settings or choose a video with a lower resolution. You have three options to choose from; Ultra High Definition (4K), High Definition (HD), and Standard Definition. 

It is worth noting that the Exodus Redux is legal, but streaming prohibited, geo-restricted, or copyrighted material can still land you in trouble with the authorities. For this reason, it is imperative to connect to a VPN to hide your IP address. 

The difference between Exodus Redux and Exodus V8 

Exodus V8 was discontinued in 2018 and is not available on Kodi anymore. Exodus Redux is a fork of the original Exodus; an independent developer created it hoping to revive the original Exodus V8 addon. 

Frequently Asked Questions About Exodus Redux 

Does Exodus Redux Work on the Amazon Fire Stick?

Yes, Exodus Redux works on all Kodi-compatible devices.

Does Exodus Redux Still Work In 2021?

Yes, but it doesn’t work with the latest Kodi version. 

Can I Download Content on the Exodus Redux Platform?

Yes, you can, but you’ll first need to enable downloads from Kodi settings.

Is Exodus Redux Free?

Yes, it is free. 

Do I Need A VPN to Use Exodus?

Not really, but using a VPN will protect your privacy and reduce your bandwidth by 50%, which in return improves the content quality.

How Do I Update Exodus Redux?

On Kodi’s homepage, click Addons on the left menu, and then click Update on the addon information page. 

Conclusion

Exodus Redux is slowly reclaiming its predecessor’s position as one of the best Kodi entertainment addons. It comes equipped with open scrappers that guarantee high-quality links in seconds, an easy-to-use interface, and a vast content library.

You, therefore, need to set your device to allow installation from unknown sources to complete Venom installation.

  • Enable unknown sources.

  1. Name of the Add-on: Venom

Common Issues With Venom

Sometimes, you may face several challenges while installing or using add-ons like Venom. Here are some of the problems you may encounter with Venom and their most effective solutions:

Venom ‘Failed to Install Dependency Error’

The most common reason for this error is internet failure or shutting down of the repository. If the repository you are using to install Venom is not working, the add-on will still appear on the list of add-ons on your device.

But when you proceed to install it, an ‘Installation Failed’ error message will appear on the screen. Here are some of the best ways to fix this problem:

Check Your Internet Connection

A good internet connection is required to install any add-ons that have online hosts. So before you begin installing Venom, ensure you set up Kodi network settings correctly. Also, check the speed and stability of the device’s internet connection. 

Enable Unknown Sources on the Device

For security reasons, many streaming devices automatically default to blocking app installation from third-party sources. Therefore, to properly install the Venom add-on on Kodi, other than enabling unknown sources, you need to enable the unknown sources feature on your streaming device, too; otherwise, the installation will fail. 

You can find this option in your device’s Settings menu.  

Use the Official Repository

While Venom is available on many repositories, only a few of these will work correctly. Most will bring up the ‘Failed To Install Dependency’ error when you try to install. 

Other unofficial repositories have add-ons with viruses that you may accidentally install. As a result, it’s advisable to install Venom from the official repository, which is safe, to avoid these unnecessary risks and installation failure errors.

Install the Latest Version of Venom Add-On

Kodi can’t install an outdated version of Venom. To fix this problem, install the add-on’s latest working version available from the official repository.

Venom Error Check Log

‘Check Log’ error is another major problem you may encounter when trying to install Venom. This error mainly appears when the repository you are using to install the add-on has missing files. However, having a full cache can also cause an Error Check Log.

Here are a few quick fixes for this problem:

Clear Kodi Cache

As earlier mentioned, a cache is a temporary spot that saves data you frequently use for easy access in the future. However, all add-ons, including Venom, only require a certain amount of data. 

Updating the URL Resolver

Exceeding this set amount usually will prompt the ‘Error Check Log’ message and also cause buffering. But clearing the Kodi cache frees up necessary space, eventually fixing the error. It also allows Venom to have room for a video playback buffer, giving you an excellent streaming performance.

URL Resolver is one of Kodi’s fundamental content streaming tools. Almost all add-ons, including Venom, function with the help of URL resolvers. A URL resolver is a tool that scrapes links from different sources on the internet and decodes file hosts when you click on a streaming link to play a video. Therefore, an outdated URL resolver may lead to a ‘Check Log’ Error.

URL resolver currently has torrent and magnet link support for Premiumize and Real Debrid, meaning you automatically receive the latest version when installing the Venom add-on. But if you still see the ‘Check The Log For More Information’ error even with the latest Venom add-on version, manually updating the URL resolver may be necessary.

Use a VPN

If you still receive the error after clearing cache and updating your URL Resolver, it may be because you are trying to access geo-restricted or copyrighted content. This error may also appear when your Internet Service Provider blocks a source for copyright infringement. 

Connecting to a VPN lets you bypass any geo-restrictions and ISP blocks. This way, you can stream content anonymously and securely. 

Venom ‘No Stream Available Error’

You may also notice a ‘No Streams Available’ error when you launch Venom, search for a movie or TV show. This error mainly occurs when the stream you’re looking for is new, thus unavailable or when it’s too old for your web scrapers to grab.

Other times, Venom may fail to play content from the provider because of your network connectivity, firewall, or cache. Here are some of the best solutions to this problem:

Clear Cache

As earlier noted, clearing cache regularly is essential for the Venom add-on to function correctly. It’s also another way to keep your add-on running smoothly and removes any unnecessary clutter slowing down your device and add-on, leading to the ‘No Stream Available’ error. 

Fix Any Network Problems

Network interference can sometimes cause a ‘No Streams Available’ error. The good news is that network problems are generally easy to fix. First, unplug your router from its power source, and wait for a few minutes then plug it back in. This usually solves any connection issue.

If the problem persists, increase your internet timeout from Kodi settings. Timeout adjustment is an excellent solution to the ‘No Stream Available’ error, especially when your internet speed is decent but your device isn’t streaming or downloading fast enough. Still, it’s essential to test your internet speed before adjusting the timeout just in case speed is the problem.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

Do I Need a Real-Debrid Account To Use Venom?

Yes, because Venom’s recent updates lock out free sources.

Do I Need a VPN To Use Venom?

While using a VPN secures your data and maintains your privacy, a VPN is not always necessary when using the Venom add-on. Premium accounts like Real-Debrid encrypt your internet traffic in HTTPS, ensuring privacy.

Is It Safe To Use Cached Torrents With the Venom Add-On?

Yes, accessing cached files with this add-on is safe. Premium account integration means that you download and store files on your debrid service provider’s server using the HTTPS encryption protocol. 

Is the Venom Add-On Legal?

Yes, using the Venom add-on itself is safe and legal. Using Venom to stream copyrighted content that is otherwise not freely available is, however, illegal.

Conclusion

Overall, Venom is an excellent entertainment add-on with a simple yet beautiful user interface. Besides, its Real-Debrid integration makes it a top choice for any media content enthusiast keen on variety and high-quality streaming.

Update the Addon

Using an outdated addon can cause the ‘No Stream Available’ error on Kodi. To avoid this, constantly update the Chaturbate addon as soon as the developer releases a newer version. 

Fix Your Internet Connection

A slow or weak internet connection interrupts the data path between Kodi’s servers and the internet servers. For instance, slow internet will have your search request timed out. In addition, a broken internet connection interrupts Kodi scrapers, returning no links.

The first thing you need to do is establish if your connection buffers only on Kodi or other apps. To test your connection, open another application on your device, such as Netflix or YouTube. If the connection is also slow on these apps, consider the following: 

  • Disconnect your router from the power outlet and leave it for a few minutes, then reconnect it.
  • Turn off the modem and remove the service card, re-insert it, and then turn on the modem. 

After restoring your connection, restart Kodi and check if the error persists.

Enable All Kodi Providers

In most cases, Kodi addons share the same providers. For this reason, make sure all your Kodi providers are enabled.

Chaturbate Fails To Play Links

Here’s what to do to fix this error:

  • Change your playback settings to Source Select. If the first link fails to play, you simply move on to the next until you find one that works.

To solve this error, use a static IP address. This kind of IP address is specific to your Kodi-connected devices. When you sign in to Kodi using this IP address, the hoster sites save your login credentials. Browsing through different Kodi builds to find the right one can be a daunting task; for this reason, this article provides a list of the best Kodi builds in the market. The builds are compatible with FireStick, Android phones, Windows, MacBooks, and other devices.

What Is Kodi?

Kodi is basically an open-source content streaming software, and has been around for nearly two decades.

Before being named Kodi, it had two other names: Xbox Media Player and Xbox Media Centre.

This software allows you to access your content from local storage or over the internet using IP addresses. IPs, short for Internet Protocols, are a set of numbers that provide information about your location and the device you’re using to access the internet.
